reviews.text:
This railway station sits on the railway line heading towards Manchester in one direction and Macclesfield in the other.

This railway station does have a small car park but it is only made up of gravel and some grass which gets muddy at times.

There is no designated disabled parking bay.

There is no no designated area for dropping off passengers.

There is no bike rack at this station so don't bring your bicycle here.

There are no obvious signs whatsoever of any security in terms of closed-circuit television cameras.

There are no on-site staff here.

Tickets must either be bought before you board the train, or otherwise bought from the automatic ticketing machine that sits on the Manchester bound platform.

There are covered waiting areas on both platforms.

There is a digital display board to indicate when trains are likely to arrive, although on the occasion when I was there, it wasn't working, hopefully just a temporary fault 

There are yellow lines on both platforms, to tell passengers to keep away from the platform, because a lot of the trains passing through the station don't actually stop here.
Brillant love this place never disapointed .
